page.description: Public user defined function. The A5_RUN_SAVED_ZIP_JOB() function runs a saved Zip job. Zip settings are created using the Zip Database dialog box (accessed from the Tools > Zip Database command). Using this function, a developer could easily create a saved zip setting called "application_files_only" that zipped up all of the application files (omitting all data files), which he could then send to all of his clients. The entire operation could be completely automated.
page.syntax: Return as P = a5_run_saved_zip_job(C saved_settings [,C method [,C _to [,C subject [,C message [,C zipfilename [,L exclude_files_in_list ]]]]]])

argument.name: saved_settings
argument.description: Settings created though the Zip Database dialog box. The Saved_Settings name is specified when you click the Save Settings button. Character

argument.name: method
argument.description: "Zip" = Creates a zip file and saves it to disk. "Send" = You can specify the optional address fields. Character

argument.name: _to
argument.description: Optional. The recipient of the emailed database. Character

argument.name: subject
argument.description: Optional. The subject line on the email. Character

argument.name: message
argument.description: Optional. The message of the email. Character

argument.name: zipfilename
argument.description: Optional. The zip file to attach to the message. Character

argument.name: exclude_files_in_list
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .F.; .T. = Select all files except the specified database files.
.F. = Select the specified database files.

page.example: dim ptr as P ptr = a5_run_saved_zip_job("expressions_test_zip", "Send", "me@alphasoftware.com", "The latest Expressions Test database", "The database is attached")
